New Records: Shubman Gill top-scored with his innings of 66 (49)
Key Match Events: Avesh Khan dismissed Wessly Madhevere in the second over
Khaleel Ahmed got rid of Tadiwanashe Marumani for 13 (10)
Brian Bennett was sent on his way back to the pavilion courtesy of a sensational catch by Ravi Bishnoi
Sikandar Raza (15 off 16) holed out to deep mid-wicket against Washington Sundar
Dion Myers and Clibe Madande (37 off 26) shared a brilliant 77-run partnership
Myers brought up his maiden T20I fifty (65* off 49)
Post-Match Reflections: After taking a 2-1 lead, India will look to seal the series in the fourth game on Saturday, July 13 at the same venue.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India completed a clinical win over Zimbabwe in the third T20I as they beat them by 23 runs on Wednesday, July 10 at Harare Sports Club, Harare.
Others: India posted a good score of 182/4 in their allotted 20 overs courtesy of a brilliant half-century from captain Shubman Gill (66 off 49).
